question: What is product license key for deployment manager (dm)?

Deployment Manager license error:
DM license does not support BLE communication with the Tag
answer:
Error: Tag's configuration information cannot be retrieved.
The DM license does not support BLE communication with the Tag.

Resolution:

1. Open Deployment Manager (DM).
2. Click the Gear icon in the top-right corner.
3. Select Product Key from the menu.
4. When prompted, enter the product key PERF2197.
5. Verify the status shows 'Active Product Key' with a valid date.

Once activated, Deployment Manager will support managing tags using TED and BLE.

question: Ubuntu view and edit network connections. Use this instead of cockpit
Show the MV ALE shortcut commands
answer: Refer to the shortcut command reference below.

question: How to RMA
answer:
On the ticket, click "Change to RMA".

Pick Product Solutions Returned – RTLS or Patient Security (based on product).

Set RMA Type to Unk unless you know the correct value.

Assign the ticket to the RTLS Sales Operation queue for RTLS.

For Patient Security, assign to the appropriate Sales Ops group (WG, Arial, etc.).

question: License Key for HM – Hardware Manager License
Batch Reporting Tool for log file
answer:
Windows System Report (MobileView) — Batch Tool

What this captures

• MobileView logs and Apache logs
• Windows Event Logs (System, Application, etc.)
• Installed programs, running tasks, and startup items
• Firewall rules, IP configuration, and netstat snapshot
• Windows Update history
• AeroScout ProgramData/AppData artifacts (e.g., Instant Notifier, client logs)
• Hostname and timestamp included in the output filename for clear identification

Location of the tool
On the MobileView server:
<MobileView Install Dir>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\

File name
WindowsSystemReport.bat

Internal Engineer Procedure (demo for staff)
1. Log into the MobileView server (RDP or console) with administrator rights.
2. Browse to:  <MobileView>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\
3. Right-click WindowsSystemReport.bat and select Run as administrator.
4. Wait while the tool collects logs and creates a ZIP file.
5. Locate the output ZIP file on the Desktop.
6. File naming format:  HOSTNAME_logs_v1.8_YYYYMMDD_HHMM.zip
7. Upload the ZIP file to the support ticket.

Customer-Facing Instructions (copy/paste)
Subject: MobileView — Windows System Report (log collection)

Hi,

Please run the built-in Windows System Report tool on your MobileView server and upload the results:

1. Sign into the MobileView server using an administrator account.
2. Navigate to the following folder:
  <MobileView>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\
3. Right-click WindowsSystemReport.bat and select Run as administrator.
4. Wait for the process to complete (a ZIP file will appear on the Desktop).
5. Attach the ZIP file to this support ticket.

This tool is read-only. It collects MobileView and Apache logs, Windows Event logs, installed applications, and network/system information to help us troubleshoot issues efficiently.

question: Infant Exit Alarm Triggered After Baby Returns to Protected Area
answer:
Symptom:
Customer reports that when a baby in Transport Mode returns to the protected area and Transport Mode is dismissed,
an Infant Exit alarm is triggered after several minutes.

During investigation, logs are filled with the following error -
2025-11-11 ERROR <asset-manager> com.aeroscout.mobileview.healthcare.cache.PatientCacheImpl
UnitZone was not found in ZoneToUnitZoneCache. zone ID=1310 unitZone ID=50

Solution Details:
A defect has been identified and is scheduled to be fixed in version 5.8 MR2.
Defect ID: 107555
Description: MV - Hugs: The infant cannot be discharged because the Unit and MAP have already been deleted.
Attempting to perform the discharge results in an MV-000 exception.

Workaround:
To stop the recurring errors in the logs:
Open all infant cards in the Hugs UI.
Verify that each infant has an assigned Unit.
If any infant does not have a Unit, add one and save the card.

question: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW
answer:
Issue Summary:
Customer is unable to configure or update firmware on T15e tags running firmware 2.4 using Deployment Manager (iOS) version 5.6.8.4.
When connecting to the tag, Deployment Manager displays a pop-up message stating that only partial information is available for the tag.
Configuration pages are visible, but changes cannot be made, preventing firmware updates and SSID/key configuration.

Email Thread / Investigation Details:

From: Gidon Lissai <Gidi.Lissai@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Monday, December 15, 2025 12:27 PM
To: Kevin Clayburne; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

Firmware update from the Deployment Manager is supported starting with T15e firmware version 2.5.13. Refer to the T15e release notes for confirmation.


From: Kevin Clayburne <Kevin.Clayburne@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Monday, December 15, 2025 1:23 PM
To: Gidon Lissai; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

I have been helping a peer with a similar ticket. The customer is using Deployment Manager (iOS) version 5.6.8.4 with a T15e running firmware 2.4.
When clicking the tag image and opening the three-dot menu, the Firmware Update option is missing. This previously worked after guidance provided in October.
I reproduced the issue by rolling my own T15e back to firmware 2.4 and confirmed the firmware update option is no longer available.
After upgrading the tag to firmware 2.5 via MobileView, the firmware update option became available again.


From: Gidon Lissai <Gidi.Lissai@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 28, 2025 8:02 AM
To: Kevin Clayburne; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

The root cause has been identified. This issue exists with T15e/h/ms firmware version 2.4 and below. It will be addressed in the next Deployment Manager version planned for Q1 2026.
The workaround described below works as expected and allows tag configuration and configuration file upload if needed.


From: Gidon Lissai
Sent: Monday, October 27, 2025 8:10 AM
To: Kevin Clayburne; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: RE: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

Suggested workaround: Configure the tag without performing a Get Configuration first. Select the tag by pressing the tag image,
press the More (three-dot) menu, and choose Configure. This opens the configuration screen with default or new settings.


From: Kevin Clayburne <Kevin.Clayburne@securitashealthcare.com>
Sent: Monday, October 27, 2025 7:04 AM
To: Gidon Lissai; Arye Shor
Cc: Damon Saltzman
Subject: Ticket 336467 - Deployment Manager ver. 5.6.8.4 Not working with T15e with 2.4 FW

Customer reports they are unable to configure T15e tags running firmware 2.4 using the latest Deployment Manager.
When connecting to the tag, a pop-up appears stating that only partial information is available.
Configuration pages are accessible but cannot be edited, preventing firmware updates and SSID/key configuration.
A similar issue is being tracked under ticket 336376. An image of the message box was attached for reference.

Conclusion / Resolution:
Firmware updates from Deployment Manager are not supported for T15e firmware 2.4 and below.
Firmware upgrade capability becomes available only after upgrading the tag to firmware 2.5.x or later via MobileView.
A permanent fix is planned for a future Deployment Manager release in Q1 2026.
